intro: Biscutella riberensis, commonly known as the river biscutella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. This perennial herb is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and basal rosette of leaves. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. The plant is noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators in its native environment.
